content.description: Not a classic by any stretch of the imagination, but another short, moderate route to complement the other routes in this area. A good route for beginning crack climbers or someone looking for a first trad lead.
content.protection: A few cams, up to #4 or #5 Camalot. Bolted anchor.
content.location: This climb is the furthest left route at the School Yard. Climbs the dihedral directly above the trail.

content.description: Climb a shallow, left-facing corner past two bolts to a face with one more bolt. Above, climb the crack on the left side of the face and finish on a ledge with the anchor. The name comes from the establishment of the climbs in this area which happened quickly, on rope solo lead, in less than an hour.
content.protection: Three bolts and gear from #0.5 to #2 Camalot and a two bolt chain anchor.
content.location:
Climb the left side of the face left of

Been Caught Stealin'

.

content.description:
Variety of moves with some gear and 2 bolts gets you to a fixed anchor.  Chimney up about 10 feet, place a nut, move left into a short corner and up from there.  Crux move is probably moving up to the nice shelf about  10 feet below the anchor, bolt at your waist.

We cleaned quite a bit today, but still be aware of what you are pulling on.  It is a nice addition to the other moderates at the School Yard.  By the way, BJ did the majority of the work today, I just swooped in for the first lead:)
content.protection: Mixed gear route.  Red C3 or medium nut and a green Camalot should do it, then 2 bolts on your way to fixed anchor.
content.location:
Located about 30 feet right of

Been Caught Stealin'

.  Start with a few easy chimney moves, place a medium nut or small cam then move left into a short corner and up to the first bolt.

content.description: Kairaid is a fun, practice aid route.
content.protection:
There are anchors at the top. Small gear is needed for the start, then up higher where it meets

Chubby Hubby

(the non sport one), place larger gear to a BD #4. C3s work great.
content.location: Begin on the very thin crack on the face to the right of Chubby Hubby, then proceed up to the second bolt. You can clip it if you want to go, straight up from the second bolt.

content.description:
Climb the first three bolts of

Quickly Funky

and traverse right to the last two bolts of

Chunky Monkey

. Finish on the ledge with the anchor. This climb was "discovered" after the first two routes were established on this face,

Quickly Funky

and

Chunky Monkey

.
content.location:
This climb is a link-up of two routes,

Quickly Funky

and

Chunky Monkey

, on the face left of

Been Caught Stealin'

.

content.description: Climbs the right side of the face, starting in a horizontal seam. Good edges climb the face, protected by gear to four bolts on the face protecting the top. At the top, if you stay more on the face then it's a tad harder but the rock is cleaner than that found on the right. Finish on a good ledge with the anchor.
content.protection: Gear from 0.4 to #2 Camalot with a red tri-cam being very helpful. Also, four bolts on face and a two-bolt chain anchor.
content.location:
First climb left of

Been Caught Stealin'

. Left of a chossy chimney.

content.description:
As with

Shorty McFly

, this is no classic or destination climb, but just another route that was added to make this a good teaching area (hence the School Yard name). Climb some broken rock to the dihedral above.
content.protection: A few cams to #4 or #5 Camalot. Bolted anchor.
content.location:
This route sits between

Shorty McFly

and

Quickly Funky

/

Funky Monkey

, climbing the dihedral.

content.description:
This is basically a direct start to

Funky Monkey

. The route starts around the corner and to the right of

Funky Monkey

. After about of 15 feet, the route joins

Funky Monkey

.
Follow a couple bolts up the corner, then move onto the face and climb the crack (gear) up to the small roof. Several more bolts will get you to the anchor. Fantastic climbing the whole way.
content.protection: Quickdraws, gear from small TCU to red Camalot.
content.location: This is in the center of the tallest part of the buttress.
